speaker.whotheyare: David Lindell develops next-generation algorithms and systems for imaging the world in 3D.
speaker.whylisten:
David Lindell works at the intersection of computer vision, optimization and machine learning with applications relating to robotics, remote sensing and autonomous driving. Recently, his research involves imaging with single photons and making cameras that can see around corners.

Lindell is currently a Ph.D. student at Stanford University in the Computational Imaging Lab. A detailed list of his projects and publications can be found on his website.
